result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

8:52 AM Defendant Belinda V Flores in court.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for Belinda V Flores.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
RCAP has filed a violation report on 8-31-22.
Defense has addressed RCAP with the deft.
Deft is going to RCAP after court today.
State has some concerns given the past violations.
State is requesting a bond forfeiture.
Defense would ask to hold off on any bond forfeiture until Deft can test at RCAP.
BTC: Will hold the forfeiture in abeyance until we get RCAP results, matter adjourned.

from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report
State's Notice and Summary of Expert testimony of Law Enforcement Office and/or analyst
from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Belinda V Flores in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
